What are the terms and conditions of using the Verus software, and what should I be aware of when downloading and installing it on my computer?

The Verus software is experimental and unfinished, and as such, it is provided "as is" without any warranty or guarantee. This means that you use the software at your own risk, and the authors and copyright holders of the software are not liable for any damages or liability that may arise from its use.

The software is licensed under a permissive license that allows you to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and sell copies of the software, as long as you include the enclosed copyright notice and permission notice in all copies or substantial portions of the software.

When downloading and installing the software, you should be aware that some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (potentially unwanted program). This is because the software is a cryptocurrency miner, and some antivirus software may detect it as a potential threat. However, this is a false positive, and you can review resources from Malwarebytes and Kaspersky to learn more about these warnings.

Before installing the software, you should also review the VirusTotal detection results for your platform (MacOS, Linux-AMD64, or Windows) to ensure that you are aware of any potential risks.

Ultimately, it is important to use the Verus software responsibly and at your own risk, and to take necessary precautions to protect your computer and data.
